title: Reasons spices became less important, 19th century

content.prompt: Which of the following best explains why spices, such as cloves, became a LESS important component of colonial trade during the <u>nineteenth century</u>?

choices.label: Industrialization increased the demand for manufactured goods relative to the demand for spices.
European states developed military and medical technologies that enabled them to establish direct colonial control over most interior regions of Africa.
Some European states encouraged the migration of large numbers of their citizens overseas, leading to the establishment of settler colonies.
The emergence of anticolonial movements that used civil disobedience to achieve their goals made many traditional colonial products virtually impossible to produce on a large scale.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
